intro: Calliandra samik, commonly known as the red calliandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is known for its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, making it a popular ornamental species. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Calliandra samik is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
